Authorization depth: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not authorized) not covered.
Produces check: No verification of response Content-Type header even though spec says application/json.
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify Cache-Control/ETag/Last-Modified presence; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 behavior and correct validators.
Add rate-limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429 and validate Retry-After and error body.
Add header/content negotiation tests: assert Content-Type: application/json on 200; send unsupported Accept to validate 406 (or documented behavior).
Add schema validation: validate the response against the Plan JSON schema (#/definitions/Plan), including required fields and types.
Make missing-parameter behavior deterministic: align with product/spec, then update TC03/TC04 to assert one clear status code and body shape.
Add scenario: subscriptionId valid + requestedDate outside plan period for that subscription; assert expected status (e.g., 404) and error payload.
Add input edge tests: empty string, whitespace, leading/trailing spaces for both parameters; expect 400 with precise validation messages.
Add authorization depth test: authenticated user lacking required scope/role should receive 403 with appropriate error.
Add explicit header check in success scenarios: verify application/json Content-Type and character set when applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered_items: PUT Method - Valid Request: Successful 204 response with empty body; host transitions from out-of-rotation to in-rotation and remains unchanged if already in rotation (idempotency).
PUT Method - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent PUTs complete without race conditions and yield a consistent final state.
Authorization: Unauthorized (401) and Forbidden (403) paths validated, including missing auth header.
Method Enforcement: Invalid method (GET) returns 405.
Service Availability: Endpoint unavailability returns 503 with error messaging.
Resilience: Transient network interruption and retry behavior verified.
Performance: Response time thresholds are exercised under degraded performance.
Security Hardening: Header injection attempt does not compromise the system.
Input-free endpoint semantics: No request body required; extraneous headers tolerated.
gaps: Error Contract and Content-Type: The story states Produces application/json, but tests do not assert Content-Type for error responses or validate a JSON error schema.
Server Error Handling: No scenario simulates an internal failure (e.g., 500) even though the story requires >=400 on errors.

Unexpected Payload Policy: Test assumes a non-empty body still succeeds with 204, but the story says Request Body: N/A. Behavior for unexpected body and/or unsupported Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) is not defined or verified.
Additional Method Handling: No coverage for HEAD/POST/DELETE to ensure 405/Allow header, or OPTIONS to list allowed methods.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenario validating 429 behavior or headers when many requests are issued in a short period.
Content Negotiation: No tests for unsupported Accept headers leading to 406 or defaulting behavior.
recommendations: Add scenarios to assert the error contract: verify Content-Type: application/json and a well-defined JSON error structure (code/message) for 4xx/5xx responses.
Introduce a simulated internal error (e.g., backend failure) to validate a 500 response and correct error body.
Clarify and test unexpected payload behavior: either reject with 400/415 (and verify) or explicitly document and assert that the server ignores bodies. Include tests for invalid Content-Type.
Expand method handling tests: POST/DELETE/HEAD should return 405 with an Allow header; OPTIONS should enumerate allowed methods.
If applicable, add rate limiting tests that trigger or verify absence of 429 responses under burst load, including Retry-After headers when throttled.
Add content negotiation tests: send unsupported Accept values (e.g., text/plain) and verify 406 or documented fallback.
Optionally, add a sequential idempotency test (repeating PUT multiple times) to complement concurrency coverage and confirm no additional side effects.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Retrieve invoice item tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Positive flows return HTTP 200 with minimal parameters, with includedDeleted=true, with audit=FULL and MINIMAL, and with all optional parameters combined; Tag schema is validated.
Empty Response: When no tags exist, the API returns HTTP 200 with an empty JSON array.

Query Parameters: Strong coverage of valid/invalid combinations (missing required accountId -> 400, invalid UUIDs -> 400, invalid includedDeleted -> 400, invalid audit value -> 400, extra unexpected parameters ignored).
Error Handling: 404 for non-existent invoice item and account; 400 for invalid IDs/parameters; 503 when backend is unavailable.
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid token is covered.
Security: Negative tests for SQL injection and XSS to ensure no leakage or script execution.
Performance/State: Normal and peak load scenarios; empty and partially populated database variations.
Integration: Audit logging service success and failure paths are exercised.
Pagination: Not applicable for this endpoint (no pagination parameters in the spec).
gaps: Default behaviors not asserted: includedDeleted default=false is not validated when both active and deleted tags exist; audit default=NONE (and explicit audit=NONE) is not tested.
Account scoping: No test where invoiceItemId exists but does not belong to the provided accountId; expected 404 per parameter contract.
Headers/Content negotiation: Content-Type: application/json header is not asserted; no checks for Accept header behavior (e.g., non-JSON Accept leading to 406) if applicable.
Authorization breadth: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not authorized to the account/tenant) is not covered.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to validate throttling/429 Too Many Requests and related headers.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control (or explicit no-store) for GET responses.
Error schema consistency: Tests look for generic error messages but do not assert a standard error response structure (e.g., code, message, details) if one exists.
recommendations: Add a scenario where an item has both active and deleted tags and includedDeleted is omitted; assert deleted tags are excluded by default.
Add scenarios for audit default behavior: (1) omit audit and assert no audit info (NONE), (2) audit=NONE explicitly and assert no audit fields.
Add an account scoping test: invoiceItemId exists but belongs to a different accountId -> expect 404 (or the system-specific response).
Assert response headers: Content-Type=application/json; optionally test Accept negotiation (requesting non-supported media type -> 406) if the API enforces it.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst requests exceeding limits should yield 429 with appropriate Retry-After/RateLimit headers.
Validate caching behavior: check for ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control headers; if responses must not be cached, verify no-store/no-cache directives.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking access to the target account/tenant.
Where applicable, assert a standard error schema (code/message) rather than only message presence.
Consider a large dataset scenario (many tags on an item) to complement performance tests and verify response correctness without pagination.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/search/{searchKey} - Search accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy-path searches with only the required path param and with each query param individually and in combinations (TC01–TC03, TC18).
Empty Response: Verified for no matches and empty database returning 200 with empty array (TC04, TC05).
Pagination: Offset/limit individually and combined, including large dataset pagination with performance constraints (TC02, TC03, TC15).
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid combinations and invalid values for integers, booleans, enums, and unknown parameters (TC02, TC03, TC07, TC08, TC14).
Authorization: 401 for missing or invalid tokens (TC09, TC10).
Error Handling/Resilience: System and dependency failures (502/503), timeouts (504), and general server unavailability (TC11, TC16, TC19).
Security Hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts in searchKey are handled (TC12, TC13).
Performance/Concurrency: Large volume and concurrent client requests with response time checks (TC15).
Accessibility: Basic checks on response payload naming/structure for screen-reader friendliness (TC20).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No validation of Cache-Control/ETag headers or conditional requests (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios to trigger/validate 429 Too Many Requests or rate-limit headers.
Authorization Depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permissions/roles.
Default Pagination Semantics: No explicit assertion that default offset=0 and limit=100 apply when omitted; no check for pagination metadata headers if provided.
Pagination Boundaries: No tests for limit=0 (if disallowed), extremely large limit (capped), or offset beyond the last page returning empty results.
Contract Validation: No schema validation against #/definitions/Account (required fields/types), and no consistent validation of error response schema.
Content Negotiation: No checks for Content-Type=application/json and handling of Accept headers.
Input Encoding/Internationalization: No tests for URL-encoded search keys, whitespace, or Unicode characters (e.g., Renée), and case sensitivity of search.
Deterministic Outcomes: Some steps allow multiple expected codes (e.g., 400 or 422) and ambiguous assertions (audit field present or NONE), which can cause flaky tests.
Parameter Edge Cases: No explicit tests for audit=NONE provided by client, or boolean params set to false to confirm default behavior.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: verify ETag/Cache-Control on responses; send If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified and unchanged body; ensure Vary headers if applicable.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst requests to exceed thresholds, assert 429 Too Many Requests and presence of Retry-After and rate-limit headers.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario using a token without the necessary scope/role to distinguish from 401.
Explicitly assert default pagination: with no query params, verify result count <= 100 (default limit) and offset=0; if the API emits pagination headers, validate them.
Add pagination boundary tests: limit=0 (expect 400 if invalid), very large limit (capped), and offset beyond available results returns empty array.

Implement schema contract checks: validate Account objects against #/definitions/Account (required fields and data types) and standardize error payload structure assertions (error code, message, type).
Verify content negotiation: assert Content-Type=application/json; test with Accept=application/json and unexpected Accept to ensure proper behavior (e.g., 406 if applicable).
Cover input encoding/i18n: search keys with spaces (%20), plus signs, URL-reserved but valid characters, and Unicode; verify case sensitivity/insensitivity of search results as per spec.

Make expectations deterministic: pick a single status code per error path (e.g., 400) and remove ambiguous Then steps (e.g., audit field presence vs NONE); document precise audit fields for FULL/MINIMAL.
Add explicit tests for audit=NONE and for accountWithBalance=false/accountWithBalanceAndCBA=false to confirm they do not add extra fields.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01-TC04 cover successful retrieval of latest, by requestedDate, by accountId, and both; assert 200, text/xml, and valid XML.
Empty Response: TC05 (no catalog -> 4xx) and TC15 (empty catalog -> 200 with empty structure) validate empty/absent data handling.
Query Parameters: TC02-TC04 (valid combos), TC07-TC08 (invalid formats), TC09 (unsupported params ignored) exercise parameter handling.
Authorization: TC10 (401) and TC11 (403) verify unauthorized/forbidden access.
Security/Validation: TC13 (injection) and TC16 (max lengths) cover input hardening.
Resilience and failure handling: TC12 (503), TC14 (retry), TC22 (504) cover service/downstream failures and timeouts.
Performance/Scalability: TC17 (very large catalog), TC18 (concurrency), TC21 (peak load) exercise non-functional behavior.
Schema/Compatibility: TC19 (well-formed XML) and TC20 (backward compatibility) check output correctness.
Pagination: Not applicable to this endpoint; large-data handling is addressed by TC17.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control, conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since), or 304 Not Modified.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios validating 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After under burst traffic.
Ambiguous assertions: Several tests expect "404 or 400"; exact status codes per condition are not specified.
Unknown but valid accountId: No test where a syntactically valid UUID does not map to any account or catalog, and expected status is verified.
Content negotiation: No tests for Accept header behavior (e.g., 406 when client does not accept text/xml) or charset/encoding details.
Date/time edges: No scenarios for timezone offsets/Z suffix, DST boundaries, leap seconds, or timestamps exactly at version effective boundaries.
recommendations: Add caching tests: capture ETag and Last-Modified on 200 responses; repeat with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to validate 304; verify Cache-Control and Vary (accountId, requestedDate).
Add rate limiting tests: generate burst traffic to trigger 429 and assert Retry-After; verify recovery after the window.
Make error codes deterministic: replace "404 or 400" with a single expected code per case (e.g., 404 for not found, 400 for invalid input) and align with API contract.
Add valid-but-missing resource cases: use a valid but non-existent accountId (with and without requestedDate) and assert the correct status and error body.
Add content negotiation checks: Accept: text/xml -> 200; Accept: application/json only -> 406; no Accept -> default; assert XML charset (UTF-8) and XML declaration.
Add date boundary tests: requestedDate exactly at a version's effective instant and 1 ms before/after; cover different timezone offsets (Z, +00:00, -05:00) and extreme future/past dates.
Optional: If supported, add HEAD request behavior for headers-only; otherwise confirm GET ignores any request body.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/block/{blockingId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve blocking state audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Success path returns 200 with application/json and a JSON array of AuditLog objects (TC01, TC18, TC19).
Empty Response: 200 with empty array when no audit logs exist (TC02).
Not Found: 404 when blockingId does not exist or DB is empty (TC03, TC17).
Path Parameter Validation: Malformed UUID and boundary UUID values exercised (TC04, TC10).
Authorization: Missing and invalid credentials return 401 (TC05, TC06).
Query Parameters: Extra/unknown parameters are ignored and do not affect successful response (TC08).
Performance and Concurrency: Large histories and concurrent requests validated with acceptable performance (TC09, TC16).
Resilience/Error Handling: Service unavailable (503), gateway timeout (504), and retry after transient failure covered (TC07, TC20, TC13).
Security Hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts in path do not leak data (TC11, TC12).
Response Schema/Content-Type: Schema validation and Content-Type checks included (TC01, TC02, TC19).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination behavior with large result sets (if the endpoint supports it).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios for burst traffic and 429 Too Many Requests handling.
Caching Behavior: No verification of ETag/Cache-Control headers or conditional GETs (304 Not Modified).
Authorization 403: No test for insufficient permissions/tenant isolation returning 403 (if applicable).
Result Ordering: No explicit check that audit logs are returned in a deterministic/chronological order.
Ambiguous invalid-ID behavior: TC04 allows 400 or 404; expected status should be defined and enforced.
recommendations: Confirm whether the endpoint supports pagination; if yes, add tests for limit/offset (or equivalent), next/prev links, and boundary cases; if no, document as not applicable.
Add rate-limiting tests: hammer the endpoint to trigger or verify absence of 429 responses and validate X-RateLimit-* and Retry-After headers.
Add caching tests: assert presence of ETag/Cache-Control, perform conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and expect 304 when appropriate; verify ETag changes when audit logs change.
Add a 403 authorization scenario (e.g., wrong tenant/insufficient privileges) if the API differentiates 401 vs 403.
Make invalid blockingId expectations deterministic: choose 400 (validation) or 404 (not found) and update tests accordingly.
Verify ordering: assert audit logs are returned in the expected chronological order to ensure history readability.
Optionally test Accept header negotiation (e.g., unacceptable Accept returns 406 or defaults to JSON) to complete response-negotiation coverage.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/priceList - Retrieve priceList for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrievals with both parameters (TC01), only subscriptionId (TC02), only requestedDate (TC03), and no parameters (TC04) returning 200 with JSON PriceList where applicable.

Query Parameters: Broad combinations and validation including invalid UUID (TC05), non-existent ID (TC06), invalid date format (TC07), oversized values (TC11), extra params ignored (TC12), malformed/partial values (TC19), and date boundary correctness (TC21).

Error Handling: Proper mapping of 400/404 for invalid/not-found (TC05–TC07, TC06, TC13), and resilient handling of upstream/service failures (502 TC20, 503 TC09) with sanitized security errors (TC10, TC22).
Authorization: Unauthorized access returns 401 (TC08).
Empty/No Data: Empty database or no data paths produce 404 or default behavior (TC13).
Non-Functional: Performance under normal/peak load (TC14, TC15), retry after transient failure (TC17), large data volume (TC18), and backward compatibility (TC16).
Produces JSON: Success responses assert application/json content type (TC01–TC04).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, 304 Not Modified, or Cache-Control/Expires headers.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios to trigger and validate 429 Too Many Requests or Retry-After/backoff behavior.
Omitted-Parameter Contract: The story states omission may return default or error; tests only exercise default-success paths and do not assert explicit error outcomes when parameters are omitted.
Response Contract Validation: No JSON schema validation of PriceList (#/definitions/PriceList) or standardized error body schema; limited checks on only success content-type, not on error responses.
Content Negotiation and Headers: No tests for Accept handling (e.g., 406 for unsupported media types) and no assertion that error responses return application/json consistently.
Authorization Depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for valid token lacking permissions (if RBAC applies).
Date Validity/Timezone: No tests for invalid calendar dates in valid format (e.g., 2025-02-30) or timezone/edge-of-day behaviors if relevant to requestedDate resolution.
Generic 500 Handling: No scenario simulating an unexpected internal server error to verify proper 500 response and sanitized payload.
Input Hygiene: No tests for trimming/whitespace or mixed-case UUID handling for subscriptionId/requestedDate.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: capture ETag/Last-Modified on first GET; repeat with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since expecting 304; validate Cache-Control/Expires/Vary as per API contract.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429; assert Retry-After header and that subsequent requests respect backoff; verify no degradation for compliant rates.
Clarify and codify behavior for omitted parameters; add scenarios that assert the chosen contract (default vs 400) for only requestedDate, only subscriptionId, and none.
Introduce JSON schema validation for PriceList and standardized error schema; assert application/json (with charset) for both success and error paths.
Add content negotiation tests: Accept: application/json returns 200; unsupported Accept returns 406 (or documented behavior).
Include 403 Forbidden test if RBAC/permissions apply (valid token lacking access).
Extend date validation: test invalid calendar dates (e.g., 2025-02-30) and timezone/edge-of-day semantics if the API is timezone-aware.
Simulate internal server error (e.g., force DB exception) to validate 500 handling and that error payloads do not leak internals.
Add input hygiene tests for leading/trailing whitespace and normalization of subscriptionId/requestedDate.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Add tags to payment

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Successful creation returns 201 with a JSON array of Tag objects; required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header and optional Reason/Comment are exercised.
POST - Validation/Invalid Payloads: Invalid paymentId format, missing required header, malformed JSON, invalid/nullable tag UUIDs all return 400.
POST - Duplicate Submission/Idempotency: Duplicate tag UUIDs and re-adding existing tags do not create duplicates; concurrency scenario asserts consistent, duplicate-free outcome.
POST - Large Payloads/Performance: Maximum-size array and peak-load performance scenario are included.
Error handling per story: 404 for non-existent payment; 400 for malformed body/invalid identifiers.
Security: Unauthorized user yields 401/403; malicious payload is rejected (400).
Dependency failure: Service unavailability handled with 503.
gaps: Server error handling for 500 Internal Server Error is not covered (only 503 is tested).

Content negotiation/headers: No assertions that response Content-Type is application/json; no tests for 415 Unsupported Media Type (wrong/missing Content-Type) or 406 Not Acceptable (unsupported Accept).
Missing request body: No test for absent body when body is required (should return 400).
Unknown tag-definition UUID (valid UUID that does not exist): Not covered; expected 400 or 404 needs to be defined and tested.
Atomicity: Mixed valid/invalid tag IDs scenario does not assert that zero tags are applied on error (all-or-nothing behavior).
Schema fidelity: Tag object is not validated against the full /definitions/Tag contract (only select fields checked).
Persistence verification: No follow-up GET to confirm tags were actually persisted to the payment.
Boundary beyond allowed limits: No test for exceeding the maximum allowed number of tags (expect 400/413).
Header value validation: No negative tests for empty/overlong X-Killbill-CreatedBy or length/character constraints on Reason/Comment.
Authorization nuance: 401 vs 403 not disambiguated with distinct causes (missing credentials vs insufficient permissions).
recommendations: Add a scenario to simulate an internal server error (e.g., DB failure) and assert HTTP 500 with proper error payload.
Verify content negotiation: assert response Content-Type=application/json on success/error; add tests for 415 when Content-Type is not application/json and 406 when Accept is unsupported.
Add a test for missing request body (no payload) returning 400 with an appropriate error.
Add a test for an unknown-but-well-formed tagDefinitionId to define/verify expected behavior (400 validation error or 404 not found).
Ensure atomicity: for mixed valid/invalid arrays, assert 400 and that no tags are added (post-condition verification).
Validate the response schema against the official Tag definition (JSON Schema or contract test), not just presence of a few fields.
Add a boundary test for exceeding the maximum allowed tag count, expecting 400 or 413 Payload Too Large.
Introduce header value constraints tests: empty/whitespace/overly long X-Killbill-CreatedBy; oversized Reason/Comment; verify sanitization is enforced.
Add post-condition checks (via a GET of payment tags) after successful POST to confirm tags are persisted and match expectations.
Split authorization tests: one case for missing/invalid token expecting 401; another for authenticated user lacking scope/permission expecting 403.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval (200) for a valid invoiceItemId returning a JSON array of CustomField objects; audit levels NONE (default), MINIMAL, and FULL covered (TC01–TC05).
Empty Response: Invoice item with no custom fields returns 200 and an empty array (TC04).
Query Parameters: Valid audit values exercised and reflected; invalid audit value returns 400; unsupported extra parameter behavior covered (TC02, TC03, TC05, TC11, TC19).
Authorization: Unauthorized access yields 401 (TC08).
Error Handling: 400 for invalid UUID/malicious IDs; 404 for non-existent item and empty DB; missing path ID handled (TC06, TC07, TC10, TC17, TC18, TC21).
Operational Resilience: Service/DB outages and dependency failures return 503; timeout returns 504 (TC09, TC16, TC20).
Performance/Scalability: Large dataset and concurrent requests with acceptable response times (TC12, TC15).
Response Format: Body is valid JSON and backward-compat with older Accept header checked (TC22, TC14).
gaps: Pagination: No tests verifying pagination behavior or explicit absence; large-volume case does not assert no truncation or paging headers.
Caching Behavior: No assertions for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control or conditional GET (304) handling.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios for burst traffic leading to 429 or validation of rate-limit headers.
Authorization (Forbidden): No test for authenticated but unauthorized user receiving 403.
Content-Type header: Produces says application/json, but no assertion that Content-Type is application/json.
Schema depth: No strict JSON schema validation of CustomField object fields and of audit details for MINIMAL vs FULL.
Audit default ambiguity: TC01 implies audit info at NONE level vs TC13 states no audit info unless set; expected default behavior needs clarification and consistency.
recommendations: Assert headers: Add scenarios to verify Content-Type: application/json on success responses.
Add caching tests: Validate ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to expect 304 when appropriate.
Add rate-limiting coverage: Execute bursts to trigger 429 Too Many Requests and verify Retry-After and rate-limit headers.
Cover authorization (403): Use a valid token lacking permissions and expect 403.
Clarify and consolidate default audit behavior: choose one expected outcome for default NONE (e.g., no audit info present) and update TC01/TC13 accordingly.

Add pagination coverage: If unsupported, verify pagination params are rejected/ignored consistently and response is not truncated; if supported, test limit/offset, boundaries, and pagination headers/links.
Strengthen schema validation: Use JSON schema or explicit field checks to assert required CustomField fields and precise differences between MINIMAL and FULL audit content.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Retrieve account payment methods

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path and multiple success variations are covered, including default behavior and combinations of query parameters (TC01–TC07, TC21).
Empty Response: Account with no payment methods returns 200 and empty array, and mixed population states are covered (TC08, TC23).
Query Parameters: withPluginInfo, includedDeleted, pluginProperty (multi), and audit values FULL and MINIMAL are exercised; invalid audit value and extra params are tested (TC02–TC07, TC12, TC13).
Error Handling (story): 400 for invalid accountId and 404 when account is not found are covered (TC09, TC10, TC17).
Authorization: 401 for missing or invalid authentication is covered (TC11).
Security/Validation: SQL injection and XSS attempts are rejected (TC17, TC18).
Resilience and dependency failures: 503 service unavailable, plugin dependency failure (502/503), retry and recovery are covered (TC15, TC19, TC22).
Performance/Scale: Large dataset retrieval and response time are verified (TC14).
Default behaviors: Defaults of withPluginInfo=false, includedDeleted=false, and audit=NONE are implicitly validated by absence of those elements in the default response (TC01).
gaps: Pagination: No tests validate pagination; confirm if endpoint is non‑paginated. If pagination exists, there are no tests for page/size, links, or totals.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Authorization (403): No scenario for authenticated but forbidden access (for example, cross-tenant or insufficient permissions).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No coverage for 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After handling.
Response headers/content negotiation: No assertion of Content-Type=application/json or Accept header behavior.
Schema/contract validation: No validation of PaymentMethod object fields (ids, types, isDefault uniqueness), pluginInfo structure, or audit blocks against the contract.
Invalid query parameter types: No tests for non-boolean values for withPluginInfo/includedDeleted, non-string or empty pluginProperty, or audit case sensitivity (for example, audit=full).
Audit=NONE explicitly: No scenario explicitly asserting audit=NONE behaves as expected beyond the implicit default.
includedDeleted=false edge case: No test for an account with only deleted methods returning empty array when includedDeleted=false.
Vague expectation for pluginProperty: TC04 does not define concrete, verifiable effects of pluginProperty values, making assertions weak.
Error payload shape: No assertions that 4xx/5xx responses follow a standard error schema (fields like code, message, type).
Out-of-scope test: Accessibility via screen readers (TC24) is a UI concern and not applicable to a pure API response.
recommendations: If the endpoint is non‑paginated, document that explicitly; otherwise add pagination tests for page/size, next/prev links, and total count.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control on 200, then reissue request with If-None-Match to validate 304 behavior and cache revalidation.
Expand authorization coverage with a 403 scenario (valid token but insufficient permissions or wrong tenant).
Add rate limiting tests to trigger 429 and verify Retry-After and backoff behavior.
Assert response headers: Content-Type=application/json; optionally validate charset and correlation/request-id headers if standardized.
Introduce contract/schema validation for PaymentMethod, pluginInfo, and audit structures (required fields, types, allowed values, and isDefault uniqueness).
Add invalid type/value tests: withPluginInfo/includedDeleted with non-boolean values, pluginProperty empty and non-string inputs, audit case sensitivity, and explicit audit=NONE.
Cover includedDeleted=false edge case for accounts with only deleted methods (expect empty array), and verify counts when includedDeleted=true.
Strengthen TC04 by defining specific, measurable outcomes of pluginProperty (for example, filtered fields or behavior toggles) and assert them precisely.
Standardize error body checks across 400/404/422/502/503 to a common error schema.
Move TC24 to UI test suites or remove from this API feature, to keep scope focused and assertions meaningful.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Remove tags from bundle

covered_items: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Success 204 when removing all tags, specific tags, and when bundle has no tags; response body empty.
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: 404 for non-existent bundleId.
DELETE - Concurrency: 100 concurrent DELETEs validate no race conditions or data corruption.
Input validation: 400 for invalid bundleId format; 400 for invalid tagDef UUID; 400 for mixed valid/invalid tagDef values.
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 when missing); optional Reason/Comment supported; injection attempts in headers handled (400/422).
Query parameters: tagDef absent vs provided vs empty array covered; multiple tagDef values (collectionFormat=multi) covered; extraneous query parameter behavior covered.
Scale and performance: Large tag set deletion (1000) and timeout handling for extremely large (10000) addressed (204/504).
Integration/data consistency: Post-delete GET verifies remaining tags.
Authentication/authorization: 401 for unauthorized; 503 service unavailable handled.
gaps: DELETE - Soft Deletes: No verification of soft-delete versus hard-delete behavior or audit visibility; unclear if applicable to tags.

Idempotency depth: No explicit test for repeating the exact same DELETE request (including identical tagDef list) returning 204 with no side effects; no test for duplicate tagDef values in a single request.
Valid-but-non-associated tagDef(s): Behavior not tested when a provided tagDef UUID is valid but not associated to the bundle (should likely be 204 and ignore).
Valid-but-unknown tagDef definition: Not covered when tagDef UUID is syntactically valid but does not exist in the system (expected 400/404 needs specification).
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not permitted) not covered; only 401 Unauthorized tested.
Response headers/content negotiation: Not asserting Content-Type=application/json on error responses; not asserting no Content-Type and Content-Length=0 on 204.
Collection format enforcement: No negative test for comma-separated tagDef values (should be rejected or parsed per spec); no test for ordering/duplicate handling.
Header value validation: No test for empty/whitespace X-Killbill-CreatedBy or excessive length handling.
Ambiguous expectation: One scenario allows 400 or 422; expected outcome should be deterministic.
Spec alignment: Scenario allowing unknown extra query params to pass (204) may not align with strict validation unless explicitly allowed by spec.
recommendations: Add an idempotency scenario: repeat the same DELETE (same tagDef list) twice; both should return 204 with no further changes; include duplicate tagDef values in a single request and verify graceful handling.
Add scenario for valid tagDef UUIDs not associated to the bundle to confirm outcome (likely 204, no-op).
Add scenario for valid-but-nonexistent tagDef definition UUID to define expected status (400 or 404) and error payload.
Add 403 Forbidden test case for an authenticated user lacking permission.
Assert response headers: for 204 ensure empty body and appropriate headers (no Content-Type, Content-Length=0); for errors assert Content-Type=application/json and structured error body.
Enforce collectionFormat=multi: add a negative test using comma-separated tagDef values; verify server rejects or handles per spec; also check order irrelevance and duplicate elimination.
Add header value validation for X-Killbill-CreatedBy (empty string, whitespace-only, overly long) with expected 400.

If soft-delete/audit trails apply, add tests to verify audit entries created with CreatedBy/Reason/Comment and that tags are flagged/recorded appropriately; if not applicable, mark soft delete explicitly as N/A.
Make expected outcomes deterministic (e.g., replace 400 or 422 with a single expected status).
Clarify and align behavior for unknown query parameters with API spec; add test to assert either rejection with 400 or explicit ignore if allowed.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Retrieve account invoice payments

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios validate 200 responses returning a JSON array of InvoicePayment objects, including defaults and combined query params (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC16, TC20).
Empty Response: Explicit coverage when no invoice payments exist (TC07, TC17).

Query Parameters: Broad coverage of withPluginInfo, withAttempts, pluginProperty (multi), audit (FULL/MINIMAL), invalid value handling, unknown params ignored, and combinations (TC02–TC06, TC12–TC14, TC19).
Path/Resource Validation: Malformed UUID -> 400 and non-existent account -> 404 (TC08, TC09).
Authorization: Missing/invalid auth token returns 401 (TC10).
Error Handling/Resilience: Service unavailable 503, dependent service failures, and retry behavior for transient network failures (TC11, TC18, TC25).
Security Hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts are handled (TC23, TC24).
Performance: Response time expectations under normal and peak load (TC21, TC22).
gaps: Pagination: Large dataset scenario (TC15) does not verify actual pagination mechanics (no limit/offset params, pagination headers, or multi-page traversal).
Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match or Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since leading to 304; no Cache-Control/Expires assertions.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to trigger and validate 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After header.
Contract/Schema Validation: No strict schema checks against #/definitions/InvoicePayment, including nested pluginInfo/attempts structures and data types.
Content Negotiation/Headers: Background notes JSON, but there are no explicit assertions for Content-Type=application/json or Accept handling (e.g., 406 for unsupported types).
Audit Parameter Depth: No explicit test for audit=NONE default semantics; differences between FULL vs MINIMAL not rigorously asserted (field-level deltas, case sensitivity).
Boolean Query Robustness: No tests for withPluginInfo/withAttempts=false explicitly, invalid boolean values, or case sensitivity handling.

pluginProperty Edge Cases: No tests for empty value (pluginProperty=), duplicates, whitespace, special character encoding beyond "="; no explicit assertion that non-matching filters yield an empty array.
Deterministic Ordering: No assertion on consistent sort order of results (e.g., by payment date) to ensure stable outputs.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: request first page with a small limit, verify pagination headers/fields, then fetch next page and assert no overlap and full coverage; or explicitly assert that the endpoint returns all results without pagination if that is the contract.

Add caching tests: capture ETag from initial 200, resend with If-None-Match to expect 304; verify Cache-Control/Expires presence and semantics; similarly test Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since if supported.
Add rate-limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429 and assert Retry-After header and correct throttling behavior.
Introduce contract tests against the InvoicePayment schema (and nested pluginInfo/attempts) to validate required fields, types, and enum constraints across all query param combinations.
Assert headers and content negotiation: verify Content-Type=application/json; send Accept: application/json vs unsupported types (e.g., text/xml) expecting 406.

Expand audit tests: add audit=NONE explicit scenario and assert no audit fields; add assertions that FULL includes more audit details than MINIMAL; verify case sensitivity and rejection of variants like "full" or "Full".
Strengthen boolean param coverage: explicitly test withPluginInfo=false and withAttempts=false behave like defaults; test invalid booleans (e.g., 1, yes) return 400 or are rejected per API rules.

Cover pluginProperty edge cases: empty values, duplicate keys, whitespace, and additional special characters; assert that non-matching filters return an empty array; confirm logical AND/OR behavior when multiple values are supplied.
Add ordering checks: define and assert a deterministic sort order (e.g., descending by payment date) to avoid flaky comparisons across runs.

Clarify TC18 expectations: replace "503 or partial data with a warning" with one deterministic outcome defined by the API contract (either fail fast with 503 or return partial data with a documented warning mechanism).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/pagination - List accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Extensive happy-path coverage for default and varied parameters (TC01, TC02, TC03–TC07, TC25, TC43, TC44, TC45, TC47, TC50).
Empty Response: Covered for no data and offset beyond data (TC08, TC09).
Pagination: Correct slicing, boundaries, large datasets, extremes, and concurrency without overlap (TC02, TC19, TC21, TC27, TC30, TC46, TC48, TC49, TC20).
Query Parameters: Broad matrix of valid/invalid types and values for offset/limit/audit/booleans, plus extra/unsupported params (TC03–TC07, TC10–TC14, TC25–TC29, TC38–TC39, TC42).
Authorization: 401 for missing or invalid credentials (TC15, TC16).
Error Handling: Method not allowed, large query string, dependency/service failures, timeouts with recovery (TC17, TC18, TC32, TC36, TC40, TC41).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected without compromise (TC23, TC24).
Non-functional: Performance and load behavior, regression boundary, and backward compatibility (TC19, TC31, TC21, TC22).
Audit levels: FULL and MINIMAL responses plus cross-check with audit log service; default NONE when omitted (TC05, TC06, TC33, TC45).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling behavior or 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/If-None-Match or Cache-Control headers; no 304 Not Modified flow.
Content-Type/Produces: No explicit assertion of Content-Type: application/json (and charset); no Accept negotiation or 406 Not Acceptable.
Authorization (403): No scenario for authenticated user lacking permission/tenant scope resulting in 403.
Schema Validation: Response objects not validated against the Account definition; error body schema not asserted.
Deterministic Ordering: No verification that paging order is stable/repeatable; sort key not specified, which risks inconsistent page slices.
Explicit audit=NONE: Omission is covered, but no test explicitly passing audit=NONE to confirm parity with default.
Unknown Parameter Behavior: Tests assume extra params are ignored (200). Spec is silent—expected behavior should be clarified and asserted.
5xx Generic Error: Only 503 covered; no scenario for unexpected 500 Internal Server Error.
Pagination Metadata: If the API exposes pagination metadata (e.g., next/prev links, tokens, total count), it is not asserted.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: drive bursts to trigger 429 and assert Retry-After; verify normal cadence succeeds.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200; send If-None-Match to obtain 304; ensure correct cache directives.
Assert headers: verify Content-Type: application/json (with charset) and, optionally, Accept negotiation including 406 for unsupported media types.
Add JSON schema validation for Account and a standard error schema across 4xx/5xx responses.
Define and test deterministic ordering (e.g., by accountId or createdDate) and verify consistent ordering across repeat calls and adjacent pages.
Add an explicit audit=NONE scenario to verify behavior equals omission.
Add RBAC/tenant-scope scenario to return 403 when the caller lacks accounts:read permission or crosses tenant boundary.
Clarify and codify behavior for unsupported query params in the spec; adjust tests to assert either 400 with error code or 200 ignoring with a clear contract.
Include a 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., DB failure) and verify error schema and retry guidance.
If pagination metadata exists, add assertions for next/prev pointers or tokens and total count presence/accuracy.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered_items: PUT: Valid Request: Thoroughly covered — 204 and actual refresh asserted across base case, pluginName/pluginProperty variations, optional headers, and edge cases with no existing payment methods (TC01–07, TC21–22, TC28).
PUT: Non-Existing Resource: 404 for unknown accountId and empty DB states verified (TC09, TC27).
PUT: Concurrency Issues: Concurrent requests/heavy-load behavior tested, with response-time targets and data integrity checks (TC14, TC23, TC29).
Input Validation: Path UUID format and oversized accountId (400), unsupported pluginName (400), malformed pluginProperty (400) are covered (TC08, TC11–12, TC19).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/missing behaviors verified; optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC05, TC10).
Resiliency/Integration: External gateway/plugin service failures and timeout paths handled (502/503/504), and post-refresh data consistency validated (TC13, TC20, TC25–26).
Security: Basic injection/XSS defenses validated in query parameters (TC16–17).
Query parameters: collectionFormat=multi for pluginProperty, handling of extra parameters, and large payload boundaries covered (TC03–04, TC18, TC24).
gaps: PUT: Concurrency/race-condition specifics are not asserted (e.g., overlapping refreshes for the same account producing a single consistent final state and avoiding duplicate gateway calls).
Response semantics: No checks that 204 responses have an empty body/Content-Length=0, or that error responses carry Content-Type: application/json as per “Produces” and honor Accept negotiation.
Unexpected 500 Internal Server Error path (e.g., database or internal service failure) is not covered.
Authorization depth: 403 Forbidden for authenticated-but-unauthorized roles/tenants is not tested (only 401).
Plugin property semantics: typical key=value format, duplicate keys, empty values, and whitespace/encoding edge cases are not explicitly validated.
Header robustness: boundary/validation tests for X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment (empty, overly long, invalid characters) are missing.
HTTP method constraints: 405 Method Not Allowed for unsupported verbs on this resource is not tested.
Auditability: No scenario asserts that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are captured in audit logs/metadata.
recommendations: Add explicit race-condition/idempotency tests: fire two or more simultaneous refreshes for the same account and verify a single consistent final state and at-most-once gateway invocation.
Validate 204 response semantics: assert no response body and Content-Length=0; also assert error responses include Content-Type: application/json and respect the Accept header.
Simulate internal failures (e.g., DB outage) and assert a 500 with a structured error payload.
Add RBAC/tenant test: authenticated user without permission receives 403 Forbidden.
Expand pluginProperty tests to cover key=value format, duplicate keys (last-wins vs rejected), empty values, and tricky encoding (e.g., key=a=b, spaces).
Add header boundary tests for X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment (empty string, max length, non-UTF8 or control characters).
Verify method constraints by sending GET/POST/DELETE to the same path and expecting 405 Method Not Allowed.
Tighten Gherkin expectations to single, deterministic status codes per scenario (avoid “204 or 400/413/422”), or split into separate scenarios per outcome.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered_items: Valid Payload: Successful creation with HTTP 201 and response array reflecting created CustomField objects.
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy covered; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment behavior covered.
Path Parameter Validation: Invalid UUID format returns 400; non-existent paymentId returns 404.
Malformed/Invalid Payloads: Malformed JSON (400), missing required properties (400), and extra fields handling are exercised.
Security/Validation: Injection/XSS inputs are rejected or sanitized.
Large Payloads: Near-maximum body covered with expected 201 or 413 handling.
Authentication: Unauthorized access (missing/invalid token) returns 401.
Concurrency: Concurrent POSTs to same payment validated for correctness.
Performance: Normal and peak load response time checks present.
Service Failures: Dependent service outage returns 503.
Integration/Persistence: Created fields retrievable via subsequent GET.
Existing Data: Adding when custom fields already exist leaves existing fields unchanged.
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No scenario for re-sending the exact same POST to verify idempotency/deduplication or conflict handling.
Server Error Handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error simulation and contract (error body/schema).
Content Negotiation: No tests for missing/wrong Content-Type leading to 415, nor verification that response Content-Type is application/json as per produces.
Mixed-Validity Arrays: No scenario where some CustomField objects are valid and others invalid to define all-or-nothing vs partial success behavior.
Ambiguous Expectations: Several tests allow multiple outcomes (201 or 400) instead of asserting the contract (e.g., extra fields, empty array, unexpected query params, duplicate field names).
Authorization vs Authentication: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated user lacking permission.
Field Validation Boundaries: No limits/constraints tests on fieldName/fieldValue (max length, allowed characters, null vs empty, incorrect data types).
Duplicate Business Rules: No test for attempting to add a custom field that duplicates an existing one on the same payment (conflict vs upsert).
ObjectType Enforcement: No test asserting server behavior when client supplies an incorrect/mismatched objectType in CustomField (ignored, overridden, or 400).
Response Headers: No explicit assertion of response headers (e.g., Content-Type application/json) required by the spec.
recommendations: Add an idempotency/duplicate-submission test: resend the exact same request and assert deduplication, conflict (409), or documented behavior.
Introduce a 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., forced exception) and verify proper status code and error schema.
Add content negotiation tests: send wrong/missing Content-Type (expect 415), and assert response Content-Type is application/json on success and errors.
Define and test mixed-validity array behavior (transactional all-or-nothing vs partial success such as 207) and assert the documented outcome.
Replace ambiguous outcomes with contract-driven assertions (fix tests that say “201 or 400”) in line with the API specification.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user without required authorization.
Create boundary validation tests: max/min lengths, allowed character sets, null vs empty strings, and incorrect data types for CustomField properties.
Test duplicate-against-existing behavior: attempt to add fields that already exist on the payment and assert whether they are rejected, merged, or updated.
Add a test where client provides an incorrect objectType; verify the server ignores/overrides it or returns 400 per API contract.
Assert response headers on success and error responses, especially Content-Type application/json as per produces.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/simplePlan - Add a simple plan entry in the current version of the catalog

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios return 201 and confirm creation; plan retrievable (TC01, TC02, TC12, TC13, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC23).
POST - Invalid Payload: Missing fields/body, malformed JSON, invalid currency, missing required header yield 400 (TC03, TC04, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC18).
POST - Duplicate/Conflict: Existing planId rejected with 400 (TC06).
POST - Large Payloads: Very large request path exercised with expected boundary outcome (TC15).
POST - Validation: Boundary values (min/max), optional headers acceptance, and behavior with extra fields covered (TC02, TC07, TC12, TC13).
POST - Server Error Handling: Catalog service down/degraded returns 503 (TC11, TC24).
Security/Authorization: Unauthenticated requests return 401 (TC10).
Protocol Correctness: Unsupported HTTP method returns 405 (TC14).
Resiliency/Performance/Concurrency: Retry after transient failure (TC16), response-time SLA (TC17), concurrent unique creations (TC22).
gaps: Server Error Handling: No test for 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB failure/unhandled exception) and no assertion of error body schema.
Duplicate Submission/Idempotency: No scenario posting the exact same payload twice; TC16 expects 201 on retry instead of asserting conflict or idempotent behavior.
Validation Depth: No tests for invalid enums (billingPeriod, productCategory), negative/zero amount, wrong data types (amount as string), null vs missing, currency precision/case rules.
Headers/Content Negotiation: No tests for missing/wrong Content-Type => 415, unsupported Accept => 406, or verifying response Content-Type and optional Location header on 201.
Required Header Value Constraints: No checks for X-Killbill-CreatedBy empty/whitespace or overlong values; lengths/charset for Reason/Comment not validated.
Concurrency Conflict: No test for two simultaneous requests with the same planId ensuring one succeeds and the other fails (and catalog stays consistent).
Authorization/Permissions: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized users.
Catalog Version Semantics: No explicit verification that the plan is added to the current catalog version only (e.g., by querying specific versions).
Schema Strictness Ambiguity: TC07 assumes extra fields are accepted; spec does not clarify; lack of scenario asserting rejection if schema is strict.
Internationalization/Encoding: No tests for Unicode/non-ASCII characters or leading/trailing whitespace handling in string fields.
recommendations: Add a 500 error-path test by simulating DB/processing failure; assert status and structured error body.
Add duplicate submission scenarios: (a) POST same payload twice -> second 400/409; (b) retry after ambiguous timeout -> assert conflict/no duplicate created.
Expand validation suite: invalid enums for billingPeriod/productCategory, negative/zero amount, wrong data types, nulls, currency precision/case, whitespace-only fields.
Add content negotiation tests: missing/incorrect Content-Type -> 415; unsupported Accept -> 406; verify response Content-Type and (if applicable) Location header on 201.
Validate header constraints: empty/oversized X-Killbill-CreatedBy; boundary and charset checks for X-Killbill-Reason/Comment.
Introduce concurrency-conflict test: two simultaneous POSTs with same planId -> one 201, one 400/409; verify catalog remains consistent.
Add 403 Forbidden test for authenticated users lacking permission to modify the catalog.
Clarify schema stance on extra fields and add tests accordingly (accept and ignore vs reject with 400 when additionalProperties=false).
Verify catalog versioning: assert the new plan appears in the current version and not in prior versions.
Optionally, add i18n tests with Unicode input and trimming rules for user-visible strings.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Success cases with default parameters and various query parameter combinations (accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit) return 200 with an Account payload.
Empty Response: Non-existent account and empty database scenarios return 404 as expected.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid, invalid, and edge values including defaults, conflicting/combined booleans, audit enum values (FULL/MINIMAL/NONE), unsupported audit value (400), extra parameters ignored, and empty boolean value (400).
Authorization: Missing and invalid authentication tokens produce 401 responses.
Input validation and security: Malformed UUID (400), SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected without leaking sensitive info.
Non-functional extras: Concurrency, large payload, timeout, service unavailability (503), retry after transient network failure, and backward compatibility are exercised.
Not applicable: Pagination does not apply to a single-resource GET endpoint.
gaps: Caching behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match or Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, no verification of Cache-Control headers, and no 304 Not Modified scenarios.
Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios to validate 429 Too Many Requests and presence/handling of Retry-After under burst conditions.
Authorization depth: No test for forbidden access (403) or tenant/scope restrictions where a valid token lacks permission (if applicable).

Content negotiation/media type: No checks for Content-Type=application/json, Accept header handling, or 406 Not Acceptable for unsupported media types, despite Produces: application/json in the story.
Schema conformance: No JSON Schema validation against the Account definition; required fields, types, and field omission rules (balance/CBA/audit when not requested) are not strictly asserted.
Audit semantics: Presence is checked, but not the exact differences between MINIMAL vs FULL audit payload contents.
Duplicate query keys: No defined behavior when the same parameter is repeated (e.g., accountWithBalance=true&accountWithBalance=false).
recommendations: Add caching tests: capture ETag from a 200 response and reissue with If-None-Match to expect 304; validate Cache-Control/Expires and Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since behavior per API policy.
Add rate limiting tests: send controlled bursts to trigger 429, verify Retry-After, and ensure normal request rates are unaffected.
Extend authorization tests to cover 403 Forbidden (if scopes/tenants apply): use a valid token lacking the required permission or wrong tenant and assert correct 403 vs 404 behavior.
Verify media type negotiation: assert Content-Type is application/json; test Accept headers (application/json, */*) and unsupported types (e.g., text/xml) for 406 or documented fallback.
Introduce JSON Schema validation for the Account object; assert required fields/types and that balance/CBA/audit are omitted unless explicitly requested.
Define and validate audit payload semantics: enumerate which fields/events appear for MINIMAL vs FULL and verify both precisely.
Add a scenario for duplicate query parameters to define precedence (first vs last wins) or return 400 if ambiguous.
Optional: add a 304 Not Modified happy-path with caching enabled and a negative case where the resource changes to return 200 with a new ETag.
Reduce redundancy by consolidating overlapping scenarios (e.g., TC02/TC22/TC29; TC03/TC28; TC06/TC33) or convert to scenario outlines with examples for maintainability.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoices - Retrieve account invoices

covered_items: Valid Request: Success path returns 200 with a JSON array of Invoice objects; default behavior excludes migration and voided invoices (TC01).

Query Parameters: startDate/endDate filtering including combined, partial, invalid range, and boundary dates (TC02, TC21, TC22, TC23); boolean flags withMigrationInvoices, unpaidInvoicesOnly, includeVoidedInvoices individually and in combination (TC03–TC05, TC24); audit levels FULL and MINIMAL (TC06, TC07); unsupported parameter is ignored (TC09).
Empty Response: 200 with empty array when the account has no invoices or filters match none (TC08, TC25).
Error Handling: 400 for invalid accountId format and invalid input attempts; 404 for non-existent account (TC10, TC11, TC15).
Authorization: 401 for missing and invalid tokens (TC12, TC13).

Resilience/Performance: Service unavailable 503 (TC14); slow downstream leading to timeout behavior (200 or 504) (TC17); large data volume performance expectations (TC16); concurrency consistency (TC18).
Security Hardening: SQL/XSS-like injection attempts in query parameters are rejected (TC15, TC27).
Regression/Compatibility: Unpaid filter correctness and backward compatibility without query params (TC19, TC20).
Integration Robustness: Graceful handling of inconsistent downstream data (TC28).
gaps: Pagination: No concrete verification of pagination mechanics (e.g., limit/offset/page size, next/prev links/headers, deterministic ordering). TC16 mentions pagination but does not assert behavior.
Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match or Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since leading to 304 Not Modified; no Cache-Control assertions.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to trigger and verify 429 responses, Retry-After headers, or backoff behavior.
Content Negotiation/Headers: 'Produces: application/json' not explicitly asserted; no checks for Content-Type or Accept handling.

Audit Defaults and Enum Validation: No explicit test for audit default NONE or audit=NONE; no test for invalid enum values (e.g., audit='INVALID') or case sensitivity; no verification of field presence differences across NONE/MINIMAL/FULL.
Input Validation Details: No tests for malformed dates (e.g., '2023-13-01', non-ISO formats, time zones) or invalid boolean values ('yes', '1', 'abc') and their corresponding error codes.
Invoice Schema Contract: Scenarios do not validate the response against the '#/definitions/Invoice' schema (required fields, types, enums).
Authorization 403: If RBAC/permissioning is applicable, there is no test for forbidden access (403).
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios: request with explicit page/limit (if supported), assert page size, total count, and next/prev links/headers; verify first/last/empty page behavior and stable sort order. If pagination is not supported, add a scenario asserting the absence of pagination metadata with large datasets.
Add caching tests: capture ETag/Last-Modified on 200, re-GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 and proper Cache-Control/Expires.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: burst concurrent requests to trigger 429, assert Retry-After and error schema; verify normal throughput below thresholds.
Assert content negotiation: verify response Content-Type is 'application/json' and that the endpoint honors Accept headers; include a test that rejects unsupported media types if applicable.
Expand audit coverage: test default (no audit param) yields NONE; test audit=NONE explicitly; test audit=INVALID returns 400/422; assert field-level differences between FULL, MINIMAL, and NONE.
Strengthen input validation: add malformed date formats and timezone variants; add invalid boolean values; confirm consistent 400/422 responses with clear error messages.
Add contract tests for the Invoice schema: validate required fields (e.g., invoiceId UUID, status, amount, currency, dates, items) and types/enums against '#/definitions/Invoice'.
If applicable, add a 403 authorization test to distinguish authentication (401) from authorization (403).
Document and test the exact inclusivity of date filters (on or after/on or before) with boundary timestamps to avoid off-by-one issues.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered_items: PUT Valid Request: Successful update with 204 and DB state change is verified (TC01, TC02, TC23, TC24).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 for unknown payment/transaction and empty DB (TC06, TC07, TC12).
Concurrency Issues: Parallel updates on the same transaction with consistent final state (TC17).

Optional Headers: Reason/Comment handled including combinations and whitespace/case variations (TC02, TC24, TC26).
Robustness to Extras: Unsupported body fields and query parameters are ignored without error (TC13, TC25).
Boundary Values: Max/min values for AdminPayment fields succeed (TC14, TC15).
Dependency Failures: Timeouts and degraded services handled with appropriate 503/504 or resilience strategy (TC16, TC22).
Security: SQL injection and XSS payloads are blocked/sanitized (TC18, TC19).
Relationship Validation: Mismatched payment/transaction association errors out (TC27).
Performance: High-load behavior with SLO assertion (TC21).
Authorization: 401 Unauthorized when credentials are missing/invalid (TC11).
Regression: Previously problematic state now succeeds (TC20).
gaps: PUT Partial Update semantics: No test that missing required fields inside AdminPayment are rejected (400), nor explicit confirmation that partial updates beyond allowed fields are rejected.
PUT Idempotency: No scenario verifying that repeating the same PUT produces 204 and no additional side effects (state remains unchanged).
Authorization/Permissions: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but non-admin users.
Content Negotiation: No tests for missing/wrong Content-Type (expect 415) or unsupported Accept headers (e.g., 406 if applicable).
Server Error Handling: No simulation of internal failures (e.g., DB exception) returning 500 with structured error payload.
Audit Trail Verification: No validation that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted in audit/history records.

Atomicity: No test that partial failure rolls back both payment and transaction updates (all-or-nothing).
204 Semantics: No assertion that 204 responses contain no body and appropriate headers only.

recommendations: Add a scenario where required AdminPayment fields are omitted to confirm 400, and a scenario clarifying which partial updates are allowed vs rejected for PUT semantics.
Add an idempotency test: send the same valid PUT multiple times and verify 204 each time with identical final state and no unintended side effects.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking administrator privileges.
Add Content-Type/Accept tests: wrong or missing Content-Type should return 415; unsupported Accept header should return 406 if enforced.
Introduce a controlled backend failure (e.g., DB error) and verify a 500 response with a consistent error schema.
Verify audit persistence: after a successful update, retrieve audit logs/history to ensure CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded correctly.
Expand schema validation: test invalid enum/state names, negative/out-of-range numeric values, and invalid date/time formats to ensure 400.
Test transactional integrity: force a failure after one state is applied and ensure the entire update is rolled back (no partial writes).
Assert 204 response semantics: no response body, correct headers (e.g., Content-Length = 0), and no misleading Content-Type for empty responses.
If applicable, add throttling tests to validate 429 under sustained burst traffic and proper Retry-After headers.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/admin/queues - Get queues entries

Backward Compatibility/Defaults: Omitted optional parameters default to true (TC01, TC22).
Error Contract: Descriptive and consistent JSON error schema validated (TC28).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios verifying pagination or explicitly asserting that pagination is not supported; TC18 assumes all records are returned in one response.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for 429 Too Many Requests or rate-limit headers under high request volume.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking admin scope/role.
Boolean parameter validation: No tests for invalid values (e.g., withHistory=foo/1/0), case-insensitivity, or coercion rules.
Date parameter edge rules: No test for minDate > maxDate (should 400), equality boundaries, timezone/offset handling, or full ISO 8601 timestamps.
Single-sided date filters: Behavior when only minDate or only maxDate is provided is not covered.
Response payload contract: Octet-stream structure/encoding is not validated or parsed; no checks for Content-Disposition/filename or ability to deserialize the payload.
Content negotiation: No behavior tested when Accept != application/octet-stream (e.g., 406 Not Acceptable or fallback).
Case sensitivity/Unicode: Not tested for queueName/serviceName case-insensitivity or non-ASCII input handling.
Input size limits: No tests for overly long parameter values (length/boundary constraints).
Deterministic security expectations: TC17/TC26 allow '400 or sanitized'; expected behavior should be precise and consistent.
Recovery/Backoff headers: No verification of Retry-After (503/504 and potential 429).
recommendations: Add pagination coverage (page/pageSize or Link headers). If pagination is intentionally unsupported, add a scenario to assert this explicitly and document streaming behavior.
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control on success and support for If-None-Match; if not cacheable, assert Cache-Control: no-store.
Introduce rate limiting tests: trigger 429 with burst traffic; assert X-RateLimit-* and Retry-After headers.
Add 403 Forbidden scenario for a valid token without admin privileges to complement the 401 case.
Add validation scenarios for boolean params (invalid values, 0/1, TRUE/FALSE case); define expected coercion or 400 errors.
Cover date edge cases: minDate > maxDate => 400; minDate == maxDate boundary; timezone/offset and full ISO 8601 date-time inputs.
Test single-sided date filters (only minDate, only maxDate) and define expected inclusivity/exclusivity.
Validate octet-stream payload contract: parse/decode the stream and assert schema/fields/counts; verify headers like Content-Disposition and Content-Length.
Add content negotiation tests: Accept other than application/octet-stream returns 406 or documented fallback; optionally add HEAD behavior if supported.
Add case-insensitivity and Unicode tests for queueName/serviceName to ensure consistent matching or documented behavior.
Introduce input size limit tests for queueName/serviceName to confirm proper validation and error responses.
Make security tests deterministic: specify the exact expected status (e.g., 400) and sanitized error payload; remove 'or' ambiguity.
Verify Retry-After headers for 503/504 (and 429) to guide client retries.
